intro: Hibbertia vestita, commonly known as the white-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Hibbertia vestita is a perennial shrub that produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
